snippet: The author of “To Kill a Mockingbird” has issued a statement expressing her happiness with the publication of her second novel, “Go Set a Watchman,” amid growing speculation that she may have been pressured into signing over...
abstract: Harper Lee, author of To Kill a Mockingbird, releases statement assuring her consent and happiness with plans to publish long-awaited second novel Go Set a Watchman; statement responds to rumors that she may have been pressured into signing over rights for book.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA ALTER and SERGE F. KOVALESKI

lead_paragraph: The author of “To Kill a Mockingbird” has issued a statement expressing her happiness with the publication of her second novel, “Go Set a Watchman,” amid growing speculation that she may have been pressured into signing over publication rights for the book.

headline.main: In Statement, Harper Lee Backs New Novel
headline.print_headline: In Statement, Harper Lee Backs New Novel
